channel.title: GPEML 2025 on GPEML Symposium
channel.description: Recent content in GPEML 2025 on GPEML Symposium

item.title: Workshop Photos
item.description:
Snapshots from Recent GPEML Workshops

Relive the atmosphere of previous GPEML workshops through a curated selection of photos. More images will be added after each edition.

item.title: Schedule 2025
item.description:
Daily Program Overview

Final talk titles and speaker pairings will be posted closer to the event.
The overview below helps delegates plan travel and networking commitments.

July 11, 2025 · Morning Sessions

Time Session Chair
9:00–9:30Opening Ceremony
• Speeches from Vice-Presidents
• Group Photo		Chair: Wei Xu
9:30–10:10Invited Talk: Linear Genetic Programming
Speaker: Prof. Wolfgang Banzhaf		Chair: Jing Liang
10:10–10:30Tea BreakChair: —
10:30–11:10Invited Talk: Revisiting Evolutionary Machine Learning – 50 Years of Development
Speaker: Prof. Mengjie Zhang		Chair: Liang Feng
11:10–11:50Invited Talk: Co-Evolutionary Approach to Program and Test Case Generation with Large Language Models
Speaker: Prof. Yuan Yuan		Chair: —
11:50–12:20Panel Discussion: What are the unique advantages of GPEML? What are the biggest bottlenecks in GPEML development and real-world adoption, and how to overcome them?
Panelists: Prof. Mengjie Zhang, Prof. Wolfgang Banzhaf, Prof. Chao Qian, Prof. Yuan Yuan, Prof. Yanan Sun		Chair: Bing Xue

July 11, 2025 · Afternoon Sessions

Time Session Chair
14:00–14:40Invited Talk: Evolutionary Learning – From Theory to Practice
Speaker: Prof. Chao Qian		Chair: Yu Xue
14:40–15:20Invited Talk: Feature Space Transformations with Genetic Programming
Speaker: Prof. Leonardo Trujillo		Chair: P. N. Suganthan
15:20–15:40Tea BreakChair: —
15:40–16:20Invited Talk: Runtime Analysis of Evolutionary NAS for Multiclass Classification
Speaker: Prof. Yanan Sun		Chair: Xiny Zhou
16:20–17:00Invited Talk: How Neutrality Shapes Evolution – Simplicity Bias and Search
Speaker: A/Prof. Ting Hu		Chair: Wenjing Hong
17:00–17:40Invited Talk: Automated Algorithm Design with Large Language Models
Speaker: A/Prof. Zichao Lu		Chair: Ying Bi

July 12, 2025 · Morning Sessions

Time Session Chair
9:00–9:40Invited Talk: Training Autoencoders with Cooperative Coevolution
Speaker: Dr. Erik Hemberg		Chair: Peng Wang
9:40–10:20Invited Talk: Neural PDE Solvers: From Black-Box Approximators to Transparent Scientific Tools via Evolution-Inspired Strategies
Speaker: Prof. Min Jiang		Chair: Wei Li
10:20–10:40Tea BreakChair: —
10:40–11:20Invited Talk: Evolving Models, Exploring Spaces: Evolutionary Computation as a Pathway to Efficiency and Creativity
Speaker: A/Prof. Penousal Machado		Chair: Caitong Yue
11:20–12:00Invited Talk: Genetic Programming for Automated Feature and Model Learning: From Theory to Real-World Applications
Speaker: Prof. Bing Xue		Chair: Cuie Yang
12:00–12:30Panel Discussion: How to Publish GPEML Papers in Top-Tier Conferences and Journals?
Panelists: Prof. Bing Xue, A/Prof. Penousal Machado, Prof. Leonardo Trujillo, Prof. Min Jiang, Prof. Jinghui Zhong		Chair: Ting Hu

July 12, 2025 · Afternoon Sessions

Time Session Chair
14:00–14:40Invited Talk: Data-driven Optimization of Complex Systems Assisted by Small and Large Models
Speaker: Prof. Yaochu Jin		Chair: Mengjie Zhang
14:40–15:20Invited Talk: Integrating Pretrained Transformers with Genetic Programming for Symbolic Regression
Speaker: Prof. Jinghui Zhong		Chair: Wei Du
15:20–15:40Tea BreakChair: —
15:40–16:20Invited Talk: Innovative Applications of Genetic Programming in Agricultural Remote Sensing
Speaker: Prof. Miao Lu		Chair: Ke Chen
16:20–17:00Invited Talk: Greedy is Good?!
Speaker: A/Prof. Yahui Jia		Chair: Qiqi Liu
17:00–17:40Research on GPEML in Zhengzhou University & Closing Ceremony
Speaker: Prof. Ying Bi		Chair: Gonglin Yuan
